intro: Senecio peguanus, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Senecio peguanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking appearance.
